column5: Being a canoeist, I already have a throw rope as req'd by law. The many boaters on here no doubt have at least 1 as well. I'd recommend carrying 1 each when 2 or more are ice fishing, esp on dicey ice like we have right now. If you don't have 1 I suggest a proper throw rope rather than 1 of those el cheapo sold at Can Tire to fulfill the min legal req'mts.  Stay safe out there!
Yep, a towel, dry clothes and water proof matches in a dry bag can't hurt either when in the early and late season of ice capades.
Saw someone go through on a 4wheeler on Quinte whose life was likely saved by someone nearby on foot tossing out a throw rope to him.
Most important safety equipment is your brain. Use it!  S.
